What did I spend my time on today

Today I learned more about how Kubernetes handles exposing web applications to external requests. Setting up an ingress in Kubernetes allows external requests to get routed to the correct service within the Kubernetes cluster. This wraps up a lot of functionality into one abstraction, handling proxy service, load balancing as well as some DNS mapping features. Learning more about all of the features Kubernetes offers, I am really starting to understand why it has become the leading container orchestration platform.

Random thoughts for today

Sometimes we can be our own worst enemies when it comes to searching for happiness in our lives. We have a hard time believing that things can’t get “better.” So we end up chasing things that we think will make us happy when instead we should just be focused on what is right in front of us.
